intro: Oporanthus siculus, commonly known as the Sicilian oporanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small and white or greenish in color. Oporanthus siculus is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and arid conditions.
